Hey Y’all, I’ve been trying to update a Vivid Hosting Radio through the configuration page, and when I try to update it, I get Type Error: Failed to Fetch. Does anyone know what the cause of that might be? Thanks!

Update: We power cycled the radio and fixed the issue

We were able to successfully get the radio to update, but now are unable to see it on our ethernet.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":4,"updated_at":"2025-03-25T18:17:01.340Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":79,"readers_count":78,"score":20.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":496883,"topic_slug":"vivid-radio-updating-type-error-failed-to-fetch","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":48541,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"now a sad alumni"},"post_url":"/t/vivid-radio-updating-type-error-failed-to-fetch/496883/3","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3568433,"name":"Joseph Walters","username":"Jwal","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jwal/{size}/228161_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-25T20:33:29.124Z","cooked":"

Is your network adapter set to DHCP?

Did you unplug and plug back in the Ethernet cable after configuration?

After configuration with your team number, the radio resets its network ports to the 10.TE.AM.xx standard instead of where you may be been reaching it before at 10.0.1.1 or other IP addresses.

So you need to ensure your computer is now after reconfiguration on the correct subnet. You can set this staticly, or if you are set to “automatic (DHCP)”, if you unplug and plug back in the Ethernet cable it will auto-negociate a new IP address in the correct subnet and allow you to now reach the radio at 10.TE.AM1 or .4 depending on if the radio was left in radio mode or AP mode.
